intro: Chromolaena leivensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian ironwood, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant is known for its dense, evergreen foliage and its ability to thrive in coastal and dry environments. It plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for native wildlife. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes considered an invasive species outside its native range.
